content.description: The crack on the right hand side of the back wall of The Alcove.  Short but fun hand/ offwidth jamming and laybacks get you up this guy.
content.protection: Bigger cams down low. Nuts or hexes up top.  I actually wish I had a couple #4 Camalots here. Huge beefy tree a few feet back from the top or nice solid cracks for a gear anchor
content.location: Located in The Alcove.  Back wall right side dihedral and crack

content.description: The short corner/ crack on the back wall left hand side. Short, quick, fun climbing.
content.protection: Larger pro.  Big tree at top further back or good cracks for gear.
content.location: In The Alcove.  Left hand side of back wall.  Easy decent on left.

content.description: short crack on the backside of the shakespeare face.  nice pumpy crack with an easy walkdown
content.protection: medium sized cams up to a #2 camalot
content.location: about 100+ yards to the left of thors hammer. features a fat 40' 5.8 in the corner to the left and another 5.5 corner to the left of that. shade.

content.description: One of the only shady spots to climb at East Peak.  Short but decent routes free from sun, wind, and potential rock throwing Castle Craig visitors.  Very secluded except for the occasional passerby on the Metacomet trail although if your quiet they wont even know your there.  Takes a while for this little nook to dry out after rain.
